tool.name: StatsExtent

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: Input_data
param.displayname: Input data to calculate extent and coverage for
param.dialogReference:
Specify the path and filename of the input spatial dataset. For the input dataset, please ensure:

  • It is in a projected coordinate system with the linear unit in metres.

  • If it is a raster, it is of the integer data type.

  • It has been clipped to the boundary of the study area.

param.name: Class_column
param.dialogReference: Specify the column or field within the input dataset that contains the values that represent the distinct classes of the data. For example, this may be the column that contains the land cover codes or class names. For rasters, this parameter is typically VALUE.

tool.summary:
The aim of this tool is to take an input shapefile or raster dataset and calculate the extent (area in square kilometres) and coverage (%) of each class within the dataset, automatically producing a table that can be further analysed in other programmes. This table is a .CSV file and contains information about the class, extent, and coverage.

For the input dataset, please ensure:

  • It is in a projected coordinate system with the linear unit in metres.

  • If it is a raster, it is of the integer data type.

  • It has been clipped to the boundary of the study area.
